recipe.name: Barbequed Beef

ingredient_list.ingredient: 2 cups catsup or 1 can tomato sauce
1 tablespoon chili power or (1 package sloppy Joe mix)

recipe.directions: Brown hamburger and onion. Add other ingredients and simmer (may add small amount of water).

recipe.name: Barbecued Pork Carolina Style

ingredient_list.ingredient: 4-6 pound boneless pork butt or shoulder roast

recipe.directions: Place onions in slow cooker. Combine brown sugar, paprika, salt, and pepper. Rub over roast. Place roast over onions. Combine vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, red pepper flakes, sugar, mustard, garlic salt, and cayenne. Stir to mix well. Drizzle about 1/3 of vinegar mixture over roast. Cover and refrigerate remaining vinegar mixture. Cover; cook on low 8 to 10 hours (or high 4 to 6 hours). Drizzle about 1/3 of reserved vinegar mixture over roast during last 30 minutes. Remove meat and onions. Drain. Shred meat and chop onions. Serve meat and onions on buns or a sourdough roll. Drizzle remaining vinegar mixture over sandwich.

recipe.name: Casserole: Cathryn's Chicken
recipe.directions: Boil and de-bone, then break into bite-sized pieces. Put in buttered 9x13 pan. Mix soup with milk, spread on chicken. Sprinkle with Swiss cheese. Melt butter and stir in stuffing mix. Spread on casserole. Cover with foil and bake 30 minutes at 350.

recipe.name: Casserole: Hamburger-Macaroni (Grandma A)
recipe.directions: Brown hamburger, sausage, onion, and pepper. Add macaroni, soup, chili powder, pepper and corn. Bake covered for 30-40 minutes at 300.

recipe.name: Casserole: Mock Enchilada
recipe.directions: Brown meat and onion. Add chili, tomato sauce, garlic salt, and pepper. Stir together. Simmer 10 minutes. Layer corn chips, beef-chili, and cheese (repeatedly) in 2 quart casserole. Bake 15-20 minutes at 350. Serves 4-6.

recipe.name: Casserole: Poor Man's Pie
recipe.directions: Brown hamburger and onions. Put in casserole dish. Mix in tomato soup and vegetables. Cover with mashed potatoes and top with grated cheese. Bake at 350-375 until hot (about 1/2 hour).

recipe.name: Casserole: Quick Spaghetti
recipe.directions: Brown hamburger, onion, pepper, and celery. Add water, tomatoes, sugar, salt, catsup, and pepper. Bring to boil and add macaroni. Cover and let stand 45 minutes without heat.

recipe.name: Casserole: Tater Tot
recipe.directions: Brow hamburger and place in bottom of dish. Sprinkle onion soup over hamburger. Pour cream soups over all. Line top with Tater Tots. Bake (at 350) until bubbly and potatoes are browned.

recipe.name: Casserole: Tuna
recipe.directions: Mix together. Bake one hour at 350. When done, put cheese on top.

recipe.name: Chicken Croquettes

ingredient_list.ingredient: 2 cups cubed, cooked chicken or turkey
1 small package Pepperidge Farm Seasoned Stuffing

recipe.directions: Mix cream cheese, pepper, chicken, and mushrooms. Undo rolls, put in filling. Pinch sides together. Roll in butter, then stuffing mix and pecans. Bake 20 minutes at 350.

recipe.name: Chili Verde

ingredient_list.ingredient: 3-4 pounds chicken breasts or good quality pork roast (preferably with bone)
2 cups chicken stock (or 2 cubes chicken bouillon and 2 cups water)

recipe.directions: Put chicken or pork in crock pot. Remove seeds from peppers (remember to wear gloves!) and add to pot. Add onion, garlic, cumin, and then pour broth over all. Cook for at least 5 hours on low (preferred) or 3 on high. Remove meat from pot, de-bone and cut (or pull) into bite-size pieces. Meanwhile, liquefy the remaining ingredients and add flour to thicken (I prefer to not bother chopping anything too much and just liquefy it all, which makes a thick green soup. If you don't have children who are squeamish about onions or peppers, you could just chop everything fine and leave it as is). Return meat to pot. Salt to taste. Use sugar to adjust heat--adding more sugar will take the edge off any heat (really, it's amazing). You can also adjust the heat by varying the ratio of Anaheims to Jalapenos, or substituting bell or hotter peppers.

recipe.name: Chili, Spacemans Zesty

ingredient_list.ingredient: 1 fifteen ounce can chili bean in gravy

recipe.directions: Brown meat in large skillet. Drain. Add salt, pepper, onion, gravy mix, and water. Stir well. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Stir in catsup, chili beans, and mustard. Cover and simmer about 5 minutes.

recipe.name: Chinese Chicken Sundaes
recipe.directions: Toppings: green onion tomatoes green pepper crushed pineapple coconut almonds or cashews chow mien noodles

Melt butter, add flour, salt and pepper. Cook on low, stirring until smooth. Add stock and half-and-half; stir until well blended. Add chicken and stir until thickened. Layer rice, creamed chicken and choice of toppings.

recipe.name: Fried Rice
recipe.directions: Cook rice in water until done; let stand covered for 15 minutes. Heat oil in skillet. Add egg, cook for 2 minutes stirring to break into small pieces. Add meat. Add rest of ingredients. Blend and cook over medium heat for 7 minutes. (Serves 4)

recipe.name: Hungarian Goulash (Cathy Stevens)

ingredient_list.ingredient: 2 pounds round steak, cut into 11/2 inch cubes

recipe.directions: Saut onion in butter until golden. Roll steak in flour and add to onion. When brown on all sides, add paprika, salt, and pepper. Add tomatoes, cover and simmer slowly until meat is tender. Add up to 1 cup of water if too dry. Remove cover and simmer until slightly thickened. Serve over pasta or small potatoes. If desired, top with sour cream.

recipe.name: Jerk Chicken

ingredient_list.ingredient: 4 (6-8oz.) whole chicken breasts, skinned and bones

recipe.directions: Mix together, marinate and grill. Or throw everything in a crock pot (reduce the liquid).

recipe.name: Lettuce Wraps

ingredient_list.ingredient: 2 teaspoons Asian chili pepper sauce (or 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flake)
1 can (8 ounces) sliced water chestnuts, drained
16 Boston, Bibb or butter lettuce leaves

recipe.directions: Brown beef and oinion. Add soy sauce, Hoisin, ginger, vinegar, and pepper sauce, followed by water chestnuts, scallions, and sesame oil. Cook 2 minutes until scallions wilt.

recipe.name: Mexican Sundaes
recipe.directions: Simmer all of the above except rice for 30 minutes. Add rice. Serve hamburger mixture with tortilla chips, lettuce, dressing (below), tomatoes, and grated cheese.
Dressing: 4 ounces cream cheese 3/4 cup buttermilk 1 cup mayonnaise 1/2 teaspoon pepper 1/2 teaspoon accent 1/2 teaspoon garlic salt
Mix together. Best if you can let it sit overnight.

recipe.name: Pasta: Alfredo
recipe.directions: Melt cream cheese, parmesan cheese milk, butter, white pepper, garlic powder, and salt in medium sauce pan. Cook on low until cream cheese is melted and mixture is well blended. Pour over fettuccine.

recipe.name: Pasta: Lasagna
recipe.directions: Brown meat slowly, spoon off excess fat. Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, spaghetti sauce mix, and garlic. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Salt to taste. Cook noodles in boiling, salted water for about 15 minutes. Drain and rinse in cold water (do not overcook noodles). Put half of noodles in bottom of baking dish, cover with 1/3 sauce, and add half mozzarella and cottage cheese. Repeat, using another layer of noodles, cheese, and sauce. Sprinkle Parmesan on top.

recipe.name: Pasta: Macaroni and Cheese
recipe.directions: In a 2-quart saucepan, bring salted water to a boil. Stir in macaroni, and return water to a boil. Stirring occasionally, continue boiling for four minutes. Lower the heat to medium and continue to boil the macaroni with infrequent stirring for 7 more minutes. Add the cheese, margarine, and cream, stirring until the macaroni is melted. Makes 2 one-cup servings.

recipe.name: Pasta: Pasta Primavera

ingredient_list.ingredient: 1 medium onion, cut into thin wedges
2 carrots cut into thin strips (1 cup)

recipe.directions: In large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, onion, and garlic, stirring frequently. Cook 1-2 minutes. Add broccoli, zucchini, and carrots, cook 2 to 3 minutes stirring frequently. Add grape juice and vinegar, parsley, basil, salt and pepper. Simmer 4 to 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender-crisp. Toss together hot spaghetti, vegetables, and cheese.

recipe.name: Pasta: Pico de Gallo

ingredient_list.ingredient: 8 ounces rotini or other short pasta
3 very ripe large tomatoes (2 1/2 cups diced)

recipe.directions: 1.Bring 2 1/2 quarts of unsalted water to a boil in a covered 4 1/2-quart Dutch oven or soup pot. When the water reaches a rapid boil, add the pasta, and cook just until tender, according to the package directions, about 9 to 11 minutes. 2.Meanwhile, core the tomatoes but do not peel them. Dice the tomatoes, trapping the juice in a bowl or on the cutting board. Add the tomato pieces and the tomato juice to a 3-quart or larger serving bowl. Peel the onion half, and finely dice it, adding the pieces to the bowl. 3.Remove the stems, seeds and membranes from the jalapeno peppers. (Wear rubber gloves, if you have them, while working with jalapeno peppers.) Finely dice the peppers, using enough to make about 1/4 cup. Add the jalapenos to the bowl. 4.Finely chop the cilantro leaves, and add them to the bowl. Peel and finely mince the garlic, and add it to the bowl. Squeeze the juice from the lime half into the bowl. Sprinkle the salt and black pepper over the tomato mixture. Stir to mix all of the ingredients well. 5.When the pasta is done, drain it into a colander, and shake the colander to remove as much water as possible. Add the hot, drained pasta to the serving bowl with the tomato mixture. Sprinkle the cheese over the pasta, and stir to thoroughly mix all of the ingredients. Serve at once.

recipe.name: Pasta: Peanut Chicken Pasta

ingredient_list.ingredient: 12 oz.-1 lb. grilled or roasted chicken (cold)
1 medium red bell pepper (1 cup chopped)

recipe.directions: Cook spaghetti. Cut chicken into bite size pieces, place in 3-quart bowl. Rinse, seed, and cut pepper into bite size pieces. Add to chicken. Cut scallions into 1/4 inch slices, using whites and enough tender greens to make 1/2 cup. Add to bowl. Toss to mix. Microwave peanut sauce 1-2 minutes until heated through. Drain spaghetti, add to bowl. Drizzle peanut sauce over. Toss well. Serves 4.

Easy Blender Peanut Sauce 4 cloves fresh garlic juice from 1/2 lemon 1/2 cup creamy peanut butter 1/4 cup water 1/4 cup ketchup 1/4 cup soy sauce 1/4 cup brown sugar 2 tablespoons peanut (or other) oil 4 teaspoons bottled ground ginger (or fresh) 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar 1 tablespoon sesame oil 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper (or to taste)

Peel garlic. Chop finely in blender. Add rest of the ingredients. Pulse at high just until combined (about 5 seconds). Scrape sides and repeat 3-4 times. Serve at once or refrigerate in microwave-ready container for up to 1 week. Makes 1 3/4 cup.

recipe.name: Pasta: Spaghetti alla Checca (uncooked tomato sauce)
recipe.directions: Combine tomatoes, garlic, basil, olive oil, and salt in a medium bowl. Cover and let stand at room temperature at least 2 hours stirring occasionally. Cook pasta, pour sauce over hot pasta and add parmesan cheese.

recipe.name: Pasta: Sweet Tomato-Basil Sauce
recipe.directions: Heat oil and butter over medium high heat. Add tomatoes, simmer about 1 minute. Add parsley, garlic, basil, garlic, salt and pepper and cook gently about 2 minutes until herbs are limp. Remove from heat and toss with just-cooked fresh pasta.

recipe.name: Pasta: Tomato and Basil Sauce

ingredient_list.ingredient: 1/4 teaspoon crushed dried red pepper (to taste)

recipe.directions: Plunge tomatoes in boiling water for 10 seconds to peel easily. Peel and dice tomatoes (about 4 cups). Sprinkle with salt and mix well. Place salted tomatoes in a colander and allow to drain for 2 hours. Combine the garlic, basil, parsley, oil, and peppers. Add the drained tomatoes and mix well. Serve over pasta. Also good on rice, fish, or poultry. (Note: secret to recipe is to let tomatoes drain. Another trick is to freeze ripe tomatoes, then put them in cold water to peel them.)

recipe.name: Pizza: Cheesy Lasagna
recipe.directions: Brown and drain hamburger. Add water, spaghetti sauce, and tomato sauce. Let simmer and prepare crust.
Crust: 1 package Hot Roll mix. Dissolve yeast in large bowl with 1 cup warm water (105-115). Add flour mixture and blend well. Press dough on greased pan, forming a high rim.
1 1/2 cup cream style cottage cheese 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese 4 oz (1 cup) shredded mozzarella cheese

Spread crust with cottage cheese. Spoon meat mixture over cheese. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake 25-35 minutes on low rack in oven (400). Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake 2-3 minutes until cheese melts. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

recipe.name: Salad: Chicken Salad
recipe.directions: Brown noodles and almonds in butter. Mix ingredients in large salad bowl. Pour dressing over all and mix. Allow to sit in refrigerator overnight. Serves 10.
Dressing 4 tablespoons sugar 6 tablespoons cider vinegar 1 cup oil 2 teaspoons salt 2 teaspoons Accent 1/2 teaspoon black pepper seasoning from noodles
Dressing (low fat alternative) 1/2 cup rice wine vinegar 1/3 cups sugar 2 tablespoons soy sauce 1 teaspoon dark sesame oil
Mix together with wire whip before pouring over salad.

recipe.name: Salad: Oriental Salad (Mary Junes)
recipe.directions: Dressing 3 tablespoons sugar 1 teaspoon salt 1/2 teaspoon pepper 2 tablespoons sesame oil 1/4 cup salad oil 3 tablespoons rice vinegar 2 teaspoons soy sauce 1/2 teaspoon dry mustard several drops of Mongolian fire oil

recipe.name: Swedish Meatballs (Lynette)
recipe.directions: Soak bread in milk for 5 minutes. Cook onion in 2 tablespoons butter until tender but not brown. Combine eggs, meats, crumbs, onion, 1 cup half-and-half, parsley, salt, and ginger. Beat vigorously until fluffy (5 minutes with electric mixer). Form in 1 inch balls. Brown and cook in 2 tablespoons butter. Remove meatballs. Stir flour into drippings, add remaining half-and-half, meat extract, and Accent. Heat and stir until gravy thickens. Return meat balls to gravy, simmer uncovered about 10 minutes. Add more milk if needed. Makes 5 dozen.

recipe.name: Tomatoes Provencal
recipe.directions: Preheat oven to 375. Core each tomato, cutting only as deep as necessary. Cut in half horizontally and gently squeeze to remove seeds and juice. Lightly toast bread, then tear into pieces and process in food processor to make crumbs. Combine crumbs with garlic, basil, parsley, chives, salt, and pepper. Moisten with 4 tablespoons of olive oil. Fill each tomato half with the crumb mixture, putting it into cavities and mounding on top. Place in lightly oiled shallow baking disk. Drizzle remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil over the top. Bake 20 to 30 minutes until stuffing is golden and tomatoes are juicy.

recipe.name: Zesty Pork Stew

ingredient_list.ingredient: 1 pound pork tenderloin, cut into 1-inch cubes
2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed (2 cups)
1 medium green bell pepper, chopped (1 cup)

recipe.directions: Spray 4-quart Dutch oven with cooking spray; heat over medium-high heat. Cook pork in Dutch oven, stirring occasionally, until brown. Stir in remaining ingredients. Heat to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes, stirring once, until sweet potatoes are tender. Makes 4 servings.
